job_description: Is a preacher of the wasteland town.

dynamic_line: I know I might not look like it, but I'm also the town historian. I have a lot of curios and relics in the rear room of this little church.
God gives us strength through these trying times, trust me.
I wonder what my next sermon should be, any advice?
I heard there's a church, a cult really, that worships those infernal atomic bombs. Can you believe that!

dynamic_line.yes: You're clearly pretty smart. Perhaps you should spend some time poring over the scriptures. The wisdom of ages past could still help us today, if we have a mind for it.
dynamic_line.no: A lot of people don't like going to church, most of the town doesn't go these days.

dynamic_line.yes: I'm always on the lookout for more rare or interesting items from the old world, please notify me if you find some. The town would love to see them.
dynamic_line.no: Please don't touch any of my files! I know you probably have difficulty reading any word with more than two syllables anyway, it's not like you would learn anything from them.

dynamic_line: I've heard some of the faithful say there is such a thing as a 'Fallout Bible'. I don't rightly know what that is, but I've heard it explains a lot about why things are the way there are. Some say it's not-canon though.

I heard there was some church of hub-something or other that measured people's energy levels. Apparently they were based on some overt nod to some actor and a cult in Hollywood. Bit on the nose if you ask me.

u_male: Unlike that other church, men who lead the flock can actually get married here. If you ever wanted to become a preacher it's something to consider.
Being a preacher isn't as violent as my last job, but it's a better life.
How has wasteland life been treating you, <name_g>
no: Have you ever chatted up the other women after a church session? It might seem boring, but there's perhaps stuff you could learn.
Hello, Ma'am, what brings you here today?

responses.text: What's it like being a preacher here?
Do you have a task for me?
Mind if I see your locket for a second?
[Spiritual] I'm rather in-tune with higher powers myself, how do I know you're the real deal?

dynamic_line: I... I was a mercenary. Not exactly at the level of cruelty of Talon Company or the Gunners but pretty close. I got tired of that life, saw too many innocent men and women be cut down like nothing just for the jangle of caps in my pocket. I moved on and would like to put it behind me.

responses.text: Wow, that's some pretty deep stuff.

dynamic_line: How did you know I even have that. Why would you need such a thing!

responses.text: [Spiritual] I sense great significance in that locket, surely somebody of your level of faith would be willing to part with it only for a moment?. I must convene with it.
[Lie] One of my relatives recognizes that locket from somewhere. Could you let me bring it to them.
Give the locket to me before I beat it out of you, okay?

dynamic_line: I can sense that you, too, are a spiritual one. Here, take the locket, but be sure to give it back, okay?

responses.text: Thank you, I will reflect on this.

dynamic_line: If they know the history of this locket, I can't blame them for wanting to take a look at it. Just give it back, okay?

responses.text: Thank you, they will appreciate this.

dynamic_line: Okay, I'll give it to you, just don't try and hurt me, okay? Don't create a scene!
You think I would believe that, think again!
I... I would rather not say. Perhaps some other time I'll tell you.

responses.text: Not entirely pleased with that answer, but okay.

dynamic_line: I can sense it within you too, like you feel the divine that's around us all, even when we don't realize it. A lot of people aren't like that, but you clearly are.

A lot of people like to think that I'm a hack, that I'm a fraud of some kind, that I'm hiding something. I can understand why, there's a lot of people out there preaching that have something to hide, but I like to think I'm not one of them. I used to lead a violent life, but I put that behind me.

responses.text: Care to explain what exactly you were before you became a preacher?

name.str: Find three Tragic the Garnering decks

description: Find three Tragic the Garnering decks for the town preacher

dialogue.describe: I might not look like it, but I'm a big fan of the pre-war card game, Tragic the Garnering. I would be very pleased if you could get me three tragic decks.
dialogue.offer: I might not look like it, but I'm a big fan of the pre-war card game, Tragic the Garnering. I would be very pleased if you could get me three tragic decks.
dialogue.accepted: Thank you, perhaps you will enjoy Tragic some day as well.
dialogue.rejected: Guess I'll have to buy them via caravan, then...
dialogue.advice: I can't really help you here. Tragic cards seem to be somewhat random in their distribution.
dialogue.inquire: Did you find three Tragic Decks yet?
dialogue.success: That's great, three more decks to add to my collection.
dialogue.success_lie: Don't lie to me about something like this!
dialogue.failure: I guess you could say it's tragic that you couldn't find all the tragic decks.

description: Find a pip-boy 3000 for the town preacher

dialogue.describe: You see, I'm very big into pre-war history. But there's a part of my collection that is missing: a pip-boy 3000? Could you get one for me, please?
dialogue.offer: You see, I'm very big into pre-war history. But there's a part of my collection that is missing: a pip-boy 3000? Could you get one for me, please?
dialogue.rejected: Guess I'll have to ask the scavengers to find some
dialogue.advice: Look in any of the local vaults. They probably have something.
dialogue.inquire: Did you find a pip-boy yet?
dialogue.success: This a great find, you don't know how much this means to me.
dialogue.success_lie: Don't lie to me about something like this!
dialogue.failure: At least I still have a pip-boy 2000.

description: Find a water chip for the town preacher

dialogue.describe: There's a story out west of a wasteland legend who saved the world for want a of a water chip? Could you get me one so I can take a look at it?
dialogue.offer: There's a story out west of a wasteland legend who saved the world for want a of a water chip? Could you get me one so I can take a look at it?
dialogue.rejected: Guess I'll have to become a wanderer myself to find it.
dialogue.advice: I have no help for you here, I have no idea where, or what, a water chip even is.
dialogue.inquire: Did you find a water chip?
dialogue.success: To see one in person! This is a tremendous honor.
dialogue.success_lie: Don't lie to me about something like this!
dialogue.failure: Oh well, hopefully somebody else will find a water chip and make use of it.
